body_html: Yes the graph is generated from the output from psutil.virtual_memory().used. The values printed match the behavior I observe in top and since I work on this computer remotely through ssh I'm confident that the tensorflow script is the only thing running and taking up meaningful quantities of memory.
body_text: Yes the graph is generated from the output from psutil.virtual_memory().used.  The values printed match the behavior I observe in top and since I work on this computer remotely through ssh I'm confident that the tensorflow script is the only thing running and taking up meaningful quantities of memory.
body: Yes the graph is generated from the output from `psutil.virtual_memory().used`.  The values printed match the behavior I observe in `top` and since I work on this computer remotely through ssh I'm confident that the tensorflow script is the only thing running and taking up meaningful quantities of memory.
